Description: Singapore de facto moratorium on new large-scale data center approvals begins
Amsterdam Municipality announces immediate ban on new data center developments
Amsterdam moratorium lifted after one year (but effects continue)
CRU proposes data center connection measures (CRU/21/060)
CRU issues stricter direction (CRU/21/124) creating de facto Dublin moratorium
EirGrid stops issuing new data center connections in Dublin
Singapore lifts moratorium and launches DC-CFA pilot
Palisades nuclear plant permanently ceases operations
DC-CFA1 awards 80MW to 4 operators (Equinix GDS Microsoft AirTrunk-ByteDance)
Energy Efficiency Directive (EU) 2023/1791 adopted with data center reporting requirements
EED enters into force (October 10 2023)
Netherlands national moratorium on data centers >70MW IT load
Amazon acquires Talen Energy Cumulus data center campus at Susquehanna nuclear plant
Green Data Centre Roadmap (GDCR) launched with 300MW near-term capacity target
Delegated Regulation 2024/1364 enters into force (June 6)
Microsoft-Constellation 20-year PPA to restart Three Mile Island Unit 1 (835MW target 2028)
Atlanta prohibits data centers within 22-mile Beltline overlay district
DOE finalizes $1.52B loan guarantee for Palisades restart
First EED reporting deadline (September 15) for 2023 data
Google-Kairos Power agreement for 500MW SMRs (first by 2030)
Amazon-X-energy-Energy Northwest agreement for 320MW SMRs (scalable to 960MW)
Amazon Manassas data center withdrawn after 6-1 Planning Commission vote
Prince William County judge dismisses PW Digital Gateway lawsuit (appeal filed)
Kairos Power receives NRC construction license for Hermes 35MWe demo reactor
Executive Order 14302 calls for 300GW new US nuclear capacity by 2050
Second EED reporting deadline (May 15) for 2024 data
NRC approves Holtec licensing package for Palisades restart
Palisades returns to operational status (first US reactor from decommissioning)
St. Charles becomes first US city with citywide data center moratorium (1 year)
Pike County passes data center moratorium
Lamar County passes data center moratorium
Troup County passes data center moratorium
Clayton County passes data center moratorium
LaGrange city passes data center moratorium
New fuel arrives at Palisades (68 assemblies)
Jurong Island 700MW low-carbon data center park announced
DC-CFA2 launched with 200MW capacity and stricter sustainability requirements
230+ environmental groups send letter to Congress requesting national data center moratorium
Senator Bernie Sanders calls for national data center moratorium
CRU publishes final LEU connection policy ending de facto moratorium (with conditions)
Palisades restart delayed to early 2026
Starke County Planning Commission approves one-year moratorium on hyperscale data centers (5,000+ sq ft), becoming fourth Indiana county after Marshall, White, and Putnam counties
DeKalb County extends existing data center moratorium by 6 months
Meta announces 6.6GW nuclear deals with Vistra TerraPower and Oklo
Virginia Delegate Irene Shin introduces statewide data center moratorium bill (until 2028)
Chandler City Council unanimously rejects Active Infrastructure data center
Leesburg town council refuses to rezone 554 acres for data center
Provident Realty withdraws Burns Harbor data center petition
Amazon-Talen Energy 1.9GW nuclear PPA through 2042 for Susquehanna
Dutch government imposes 9-month ban on new hyperscale data centers
Meta cancels Zeewolde data center (200MW) after political opposition
Dutch cabinet approves draft decision to strictly regulate hyperscale data centers
Takahama Unit 1 resumes operation after 12-year hiatus (first >40yr reactor restart)
Onagawa Unit 2 resumes operation - first eastern Japan restart since Fukushima
NRA approves Takahama 50-year operation extension - first approval beyond 50 years
Economy Minister Muto calls for maximum reactor restarts citing AI/data center demand
Shimane Unit 2 resumes operation
New Basic Energy Plan removes phrase on minimizing nuclear dependence aims for 20% by 2040
Niigata Governor approves Kashiwazaki-Kariwa Unit 6 restart (world's largest plant 8.2GW)
Kashiwazaki-Kariwa Unit 6 restart scheduled (first TEPCO restart since Fukushima)
Meta-Constellation 20-year PPA for Clinton Clean Energy Center (1121MW)
NextEra-Google 25-year PPA to restart Duane Arnold (615MW target 2029)
NextEra files licensing change request with NRC for Duane Arnold restart
FERC approves NextEra waiver for Duane Arnold grid reconnection
Duane Arnold nuclear plant closes (derecho damage uneconomical to repair)
Three Mile Island Unit 1 closes due to economic challenges
Google-Kairos Power-TVA collaboration announced for SMR deployment
Google-Commonwealth Fusion Systems PPA for fusion energy
Meta releases RFP seeking 1-4GW of new nuclear generation capacity
Prince George's County imposes 180-day pause on data center proposals
San Marcos pauses $1.5B 200-acre data center proposal over energy concerns
Tucson City Council unanimously opposes Amazon Project Blue ($3.6B campus)
Birmingham City Council considers 270-day moratorium on data center applications
Howell Township passes data center moratorium (proposed facility withdrawn)
At least 19 Michigan towns pause data center approvals
238 data center-related bills considered across all 50 states - 40+ enacted in 21 states
Dominion Energy creates new rate class for large load users including data centers
14 states have cities/counties with data center moratoriums
KEPCO restricts additional power supply in Seoul metropolitan area; power permit confirmation extended from 2-3 months to ~12 months for data centers

Korean government passes three legislations: disaster recovery mandates for large digital service providers, additional KEPCO powers to manage grid applications and remove power from existing contracts
Korean government policy directs decentralization of data centres away from Greater Seoul Area to regional purpose-led districts
Special Act on Distributed Energy Activation enacted (June 14) intensifying competition for power acquisition in Seoul metropolitan area
LS Electric and Korea Hydro & Nuclear Power (KHNP) sign MoU to develop AI data centers powered by SMR (i-SMR 170MW) technology
NSSC approves continued operation of Kori Unit 2 until April 2033 - first South Korean reactor to receive operating lifetime extension beyond 40 years
First concrete poured for Shin Hanul Unit 3 (APR1400 1400MWe) in May 2025 - NSSC issued construction licence September 2024
X-energy Amazon KHNP(Korea) Doosan(Korea) partnership to deploy 5GW+ Xe-100 SMR nuclear energy in US for AI data centers with up to $50B investment
UK Government designates data centres as Critical National Infrastructure (CNI) putting digital infrastructure in same category as energy and water

National Planning Policy Framework revised to require local authorities to consider need for data centres when setting local policies - first specific mention of data centres in national planning framework
Secretary of State Angela Rayner overturns local council rejection to approve 140MW hyperscale data centre on green belt land at Court Lane Buckinghamshire
Secretary of State approves hyperscale data centre in Abbots Langley Hertfordshire on grey belt land - decision later challenged by campaigners on environmental impact grounds
UK Government launches AI Growth Zones (AIGZ) initiative with fast-track planning and grid access for AI data centres - zones designated in Oxford and North East England
UK Government announces data centres can opt into Nationally Significant Infrastructure Projects (NSIP) regime - planning decisions made by Secretary of State rather than local authorities
London Assembly report finds housing development constrained in three boroughs due to data centre energy demand competing for limited grid capacity
APRS and ERCS call for Scottish Government to establish moratorium on granting planning permission for data centres - proposed centres would double Scotland energy demands
German Parliament passes Energy Efficiency Act (Energieeffizienzgesetz EnEfG) imposing specific energy efficiency obligations on data centers including PUE requirements and waste heat reuse mandates
Germany Energy Efficiency Act data center provisions take effect: 50% renewable electricity mandate for data centers over 300kW; energy management systems required by July 2025
First reporting deadline for German data centre energy efficiency register (RZReg) - operators of data centres over 500kW must report energy consumption and PUE data to BAFA
France AI Action Summit: Government secures €109B+ in digital infrastructure investment; President Macron promotes nuclear-powered data centres as competitive advantage ('plug baby plug')
Fluidstack signs MoU with French government to build 1GW decarbonised AI supercomputer powered by nuclear energy with plans for scalable expansion beyond 1GW by 2028
EDF identifies four sites on its own land to offer for data centres leveraging existing nuclear power infrastructure and grid connections
Federal opposition (Coalition) announces plans to build seven nuclear power plants by 2050 at retired coal sites - sparking national debate on lifting 25-year nuclear ban
Labor government re-elected in May 2025 maintaining nuclear power ban; Coalition nuclear plant proposal not adopted; coal plant retirements continue driving energy transition debate
KEPCO designates 205 substations as system management substations (103 in Gwangju/Jeonnam 61 in Jeonbuk 25 East Coast 16 Jeju) restricting new power connections
CNSC issues Licence to Construct first BWRX-300 SMR at Darlington New Nuclear Project - first grid-scale SMR construction licence in North America

Ontario government approves OPG construction of first BWRX-300 SMR at Darlington - CAD$7.7B for first unit with total 4-unit program at CAD$20.9B; first new nuclear construction in Ontario in 30+ years
Ontario directs OPG to explore additional new nuclear generation at Wesleyville site beyond Darlington SMR project
Australian Government mandates 5-star NABERS Energy rating for all data centres hosting federal workloads from July 1 2025 under Net Zero in Government Operations Strategy

AEMC launches Package 2 consultation on new grid connection standards for large loads (data centres) citing unprecedented AI-driven demand - facilities may need to remain stable during grid disturbances
Energy and Climate Change Ministerial Council (ECMC) agrees to work with AEMO on implications of projected data centre growth for energy system including regulatory framework review
Ontario introduces Bill 40 (Protect Ontario by Securing Affordable Energy for Generations Act) requiring Ministerial approval before large data centres can connect to the electricity grid
Alberta introduces Bill 8 (Utilities Statutes Amendment Act 2025) creating framework for data centres to bring own generation and ensuring ratepayers do not pay for data centre transmission upgrades
China launches 'East Data West Computing' (东数西算) megaproject: 8 computing hubs and 10 data center clusters to redistribute computing from east to west
China enacts Interim Measures for Management of Generative AI Services, first comprehensive generative AI regulation governing development and service provision
China sets new PUE target: large data centers must achieve PUE of 1.25 by 2025, stricter than EU requirements
China approves construction of 10 new nuclear reactors across 5 sites with investment exceeding 200 billion yuan ($27.45B) to support AI infrastructure growth
China bans foreign AI chips from state-funded data centers, requiring only domestic accelerators in government-funded projects
State Council issues 'Opinions on AI Plus Action Plan' proposing data-driven economy transition with six key actions including AI infrastructure security
India enacts Digital Personal Data Protection Act (DPDP) strengthening data sovereignty and restricting cross-border data transfers
India launches IndiaAI Mission with IndiaAIKosh national AI compute pool, offering subsidized GPUs/TPUs to researchers and startups
India opens first AI data center park in Naya Raipur, Chhattisgarh, as model for decentralized infrastructure beyond metro hubs
India issues AI Governance Guidelines 2025 under IndiaAI Mission with six pillars: Infrastructure, Capacity Building, Policy, Risk Mitigation, Accountability, Institutions
Taiwan shuts down last operating nuclear reactor (Maanshan Unit 2), completing nuclear phaseout amid rising AI data center energy demands
Taiwan holds referendum to reopen Maanshan nuclear plant but fails to reach legally required 5 million 'yes' votes despite majority support
UAE establishes 5-gigawatt AI Campus in Abu Dhabi powered by nuclear, solar, and gas - largest supercomputing cluster outside the US
Emirates Nuclear Energy Company signs MOU with GE Vernova Hitachi evaluating BWRX-300 small modular reactor deployment
Saudi Arabia allows IAEA inspection of Duwayhin Nuclear Energy Company in preparation for nuclear capacity buildout for AI infrastructure
Saudi Arabia and US sign cooperation agreement for civilian nuclear energy partnership with nonproliferation safeguards to power AI infrastructure
Nagel Committee recommends 25 billion shekel (~$6.6B) national AI investment over 5 years for infrastructure, computing power, and training
Spain launches Draft Royal Decree imposing strict sustainability and energy efficiency requirements on data centers, exceeding EU EED standards
Spain requires data center operators (≥500kW) to report socio-economic impact including employment, local economy effects, and client data origins
Italy's MASE issues Guidelines for Environmental Assessment Procedures for Data Centers to standardize review processes
Lombardy Region issues Resolution No. 2629 with uniform guidelines for data center construction in Italy's largest DC region
Italy's MIMIT publishes 'Strategy for attracting foreign investment in data centers' to simplify authorization and position Italy as European/Mediterranean digital hub
Sweden implements data center energy performance disclosure law: operators ≥500kW must report to EU database, first mandatory reporting by May 2026
Finland opens Olkiluoto 3 - Europe's first new nuclear reactor in over 15 years (1,600 MW), supporting energy-intensive data center industry
Finland plans to end electricity tax subsidy for data centers and mines, signaling shift in Nordic DC incentive policies
Denmark positions as data center hub with 26% annual capacity growth over 5 years, supported by Energinet TSO grid planning since 2017
Microsoft signs 180MW PPA with European Energy covering solar and onshore wind projects in Denmark and Sweden for data centers
Norwegian government rejects state cloud recommendation, opts for national cloud operated with commercial players, trusting private DC industry
Malaysia moves to slow data center development due to strain on national energy grid and water resources amid Singapore overflow
EU announces €20B 'AI Gigafactory' fund modeled after CERN (Switzerland-based) for large-scale AI infrastructure at 7 EU locations
Germany's Energy Efficiency Act (EnEfG) takes effect: data centers must cover 50% energy from renewables (100% by 2027), mandatory waste heat reuse
EU releases AI Continent Action Plan setting goal of tripling data center capacity within 5-7 years
EU announces InvestAI: €200 billion initiative for AI infrastructure including computing power, applications, and democratized access
